thread.title: 2016 BMW M2 turns heads

author: seattlepi.com
title: 2016 BMW M2 turns heads
text:
BMW has unveiled the high-performance 2016 M2 Coupe, which has packed in more power, improved suspension, upgraded brakes, and new body design.
Under the hood, the 365 horsepower M2 is powered by a 3.0-liter twin turbo inline-six engine that rockets the car from 0-60 in just 4.4 seconds. Drivers have the choice of two transmissions: a standard six-speed manual with automatic rev-matching downshifts, and an optional seven-speed, dual clutch gearbox with launch control.
Outside, the M2 has large air inlets to supply cool air to the system, the signature M series gills, 19-inch alloy wheels, and a low, wide rear with twin-tailpipe exhaust system.
RELATED: BMW goes all out with the 2016 M4 GTS
While the M2 is a dream for those with a lead foot, the car's safety features are just as impressive; lane-departure warning, rear parking sensors and backup camera will give drivers a peace of mind.
Although pricing has not been said, the M2 is set to hit the streets next spring.
